graph

Class SimpleGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.Graph<SimpleVertex,SimpleEdge>
      • graph.SimpleGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class SimpleGraph
extends Graph<SimpleVertex,SimpleEdge>
    SimpleGraph is a simple extension of the graph class. SimpleVertex and SimpleEdge classes are internally created to manage the relations. Basically, SimpleGraph is useful when the generic nature of the Graph class is unneeded.

    As the SimpleEdge class implements Flowable and Weighted, SimpleGraph is appropriate for shortest path and max flow problems.
    Author:
    Mshnik

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleGraph()
      Constructs a new (empty) directed SimpleGraph
      SimpleGraph(boolean directed)
      Constructs a new (empty) SimpleGraph with the given directed-ness
      SimpleGraph(Graph<SimpleVertex,SimpleEdge> g)
      Constructs a new SimpleGraph that is a copy of the given graph The two graphs contain the same elements but are completely independent in terms of underlying structure, so modifications to this Graph won't alter the returned graph, and modifications to the returned graph won't alter this graph.

      Moreover, the graph is deeply copied - the SimpleVertices and SimpleEdges in g are cloned before being added to this.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleGraph

        public SimpleGraph()
        Constructs a new (empty) directed SimpleGraph

      • SimpleGraph

        public SimpleGraph(boolean directed)
        Constructs a new (empty) SimpleGraph with the given directed-ness

      • SimpleGraph

        public SimpleGraph(Graph<SimpleVertex,SimpleEdge> g)
        Constructs a new SimpleGraph that is a copy of the given graph The two graphs contain the same elements but are completely independent in terms of underlying structure, so modifications to this Graph won't alter the returned graph, and modifications to the returned graph won't alter this graph.

        Moreover, the graph is deeply copied - the SimpleVertices and SimpleEdges in g are cloned before being added to this. This is a difference between the SimpleGraph class and the Graph class.

      • addVertex

        public boolean addVertex(SimpleVertex v)
        Adds the given vertex to the graph with no edges. If the vertex is already in the graph, do nothing and return false Returns true if the an operation is performed this way, false otw.
        Overrides:

      • addEdge

        public boolean addEdge(SimpleVertex v1,
                       SimpleVertex v2,
                       SimpleEdge e)
                throws NotInCollectionException
        Connects the two given vertices in the graph by adding an edge. If there is already a connection from source to sink (or sink to source and this is undirected), or e is already an edge in this graph, do nothing and return false. Returns true if an operation is performed this way, false otw.
        Overrides:
        addEdge in class Graph<SimpleVertex,SimpleEdge>
        Throws:
        NotInCollectionException - - if source or sink are not vertices in this graph

      • addVertex

        public int addVertex()
        Adds a new vertex to the graph with no edges. This will always result in a new vertex being added.
        Returns:
        the ID of the added vertex

      • addEdge

        public int addEdge(SimpleVertex source,
                   SimpleVertex sink)
            throws NotInCollectionException
        Adds a new Edge to the graph, connecting source to sink. If source and sink are already connected by an existing edge, does nothing instead.
        Parameters:
        source - - the source of the new edge
        sink - - the sink of the new edge.
        Returns:
        the ID of the created edge if source and sink weren't connected before, or -1 if they were already connected
        Throws:
        NotInCollectionException - - if source or sink are not vertices in this graph

      • removeVertex

        public boolean removeVertex(SimpleVertex v)

        Overrides:
        removeVertex in class Graph<SimpleVertex,SimpleEdge>
